components.description: Three key stats at top: Total Supply ($1.73B), Total Available ($1.09B), Total Borrowed ($641M)
components.notable: Large white text right-aligned, summary view of protocol health

components.description: Three tabs for filtering: Liquidity (active), Borrow, Earn
components.notable: Green active state on Liquidity tab

components.description: 3x2 grid of asset/token stat cards (USDC, JLP, SOL, syrupUSDC, JupSOL, INF)
components.notable: Each card shows token icon, TVL, Supplied vs Borrow amounts, APY rates, and 'All Stats' action button

components.description: Chevron icon for collapsing/expanding each card details
components.position: right side of each asset card
components.notable: Allows detailed APY/Reserve/Factor metrics to be hidden

components.description: Each card displays: Supply APY, Borrow APY, Reserves, Reserve Factor
components.notable: Color-coded values ($768,958.07 in green), percentage rates (2.8%), factory settings (10%)

components.description: Powered by FLUID logo
components.notable: Partnership/infrastructure credit

design.visualHierarchy: Page headline + summary KPIs → Filter tabs → Grid of asset cards → Detailed metrics per card
innovativeElements: Data-rich card layout with 6+ metrics per token without overwhelming
Color coding for supplied (white) vs borrowed (orange) creates visual distinction
Expandable cards preserve space while allowing deep dives

flow.userIntent: Analyze lending pool statistics, compare token performance, review APY rates and liquidity metrics
exitPoints: Switch to Borrow or Earn tabs
Click 'All Stats' for token detail page

interactiveElements.action: Filters the statistics view by pool type
Toggles visibility of detailed metrics (APY, Reserves, factors)
Navigates to detailed statistics page for that token

flow.informationArchitecture: Protocol-level summary (top KPIs) → Asset class filter (tabs) → Asset-level metrics (card grid) → Granular APY/reserve details (expandable rows)
frictionPoints: Large amount of data per card may require explanation for new users
No chart/visualization of trends over time, only current snapshots

copy.headline: Statistics
copy.subheadline: All Jupiter Lend statistics in one place

microcopy.purpose: Shows total value locked in that pool

microcopy.context: Left column of each card's metrics
Right column of each card's metrics

microcopy.purpose: Abbreviation for reserve factor, shows protocol reserve allocation

trustSignals: Total Supply $1.73B indicates significant TVL and protocol maturity
Multiple audited token pools (USDC, SOL, established tokens)
Transparent APY and reserve metrics

typography.headingStyle: Large white 'Explore Rewards Hub' with smaller gray subheading below
typography.bodyStyle: Medium white campaign titles, smaller gray descriptive text
typography.dataStyle: Large white numbers ($2M, 50M), currency formatted with M/K suffixes

components.description: Two tabs: Rewards (active), Referral
components.notable: Underline active state on Rewards

components.description: Page title with value proposition (Trade Spot. Earn Rewards) and total rewards summary card
components.notable: Minimalist 'Connect' CTA to show personal rewards total

components.description: Search box for campaign names and dropdown filter (All selected)
components.notable: Allows users to narrow down reward opportunities

components.description: 3-column grid of campaign cards with icon, title, description, reward amount, status badge
components.notable: Each card has 'New' badge (lime-green) and 'Live' or 'Ended' status indicator (green/olive)

components.description: Colored indicators: 'New' (lime-green), 'Live' (green dot), 'Ended' (olive/brown dot)
components.notable: Quick visual scan of campaign maturity and availability

components.description: Large illustrative icon per campaign (gradient circles, character icons)
components.position: center of each card upper half
components.notable: Brand/campaign visual identity, colorful against dark background

design.visualHierarchy: Page title + value prop → Total rewards summary (right) → Search/filter bar → Campaign grid with status → Campaign descriptions and amounts
innovativeElements: Status badges (New, Live, Ended) enable quick campaign lifecycle assessment
Colorful campaign icons add visual variety in dark theme
Search+filter pattern reduces cognitive load for finding relevant campaigns
Right-aligned rewards summary creates call-to-action focal point

flow.userIntent: Discover active and past reward campaigns, understand reward opportunities, connect wallet to track personal earnings
entryPoints: Direct app link to rewards section

interactiveElements.action: Switches between rewards campaigns and referral program view
Filters visible campaigns by text match
Likely filters by campaign status (Live, Ended, All)
Wallet connection to display user's personal rewards total
Likely clickable to open campaign details / participation page

flow.informationArchitecture: Campaign discovery (headline + search) → Campaign list (grid) → Campaign summary (card with key details) → Detailed view (click-through)
frictionPoints: Search/filter only visible with keywords; no obvious category tabs
Disconnected wallet shows 'Connect' CTA instead of personal reward total, requires extra step
Campaign cards don't show clear 'Join' or 'Participate' CTA on the card itself

copy.headline: Explore Rewards Hub

microcopy.purpose: Header for user's cumulative reward total

microcopy.text: ASR incentivizes active JUP participation with increased voting power. Claim exclusively vi...

dataFormatting: 50M Staked JUP (large number with M suffix)
$1M in USDC (currency with M suffix for readability)
trustSignals: Specific staking amounts (50M JUP, $2M JupUSD pool)
Named reward campaigns with dates (TCG Rewards Season 2, Active Staking Rewards Oct)
Multiple ongoing campaigns indicate sustained reward program
